alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 4:37PM CDT until April 22 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Johnsonville Tennessee River at Perryville Tennessee River at Savannah ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 363.5 feet, In Decatur County, water inundates the boat launch area at the north end of Woodlawn Shores Road in Cherokee Heights and the low-lying areas of the boat launch at the end of Brodies Landing Road. The north end of Miracle Road in Fishers Landing is flooding. The evacuation road from Beech Bend Park boat parking lot floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 362.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 363.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall to 360.0 feet by Saturday morning. - Action stage is 362.0 feet. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
